page.title: 01Ringstead Gazetteer.
page.content: Ringstead is a small, quiet village of about 1,500 people and only 500 houses. The housing is a great mixture including old cottages and barns which have been converted,farm houses,council property,old type houses and several small private estates of new houses. There are few big houses,except for the Manor House and Ringstead House. In the village are four shops,including a post office,which provide for the every day needs of the villagers,and a fish and chip shop.A horse riding school has recently opened that is very popular with children in this village and others come from villages in the area. Most people travel to nearby towns for their work as there are few jobs in Ringstead.The doll factory employs some women and the corn stores some men.
